from_utf8_unchecked.doc: Creates + allocates a Rust `String` by **copying** it from another utf8-encoded string

from_utf8_lossy.doc: Creates + allocates a Rust `String` by **copying** it from another utf8-encoded string

into_bytes.doc: Returns the internal bytes of the String as a `U8Vec`

with_capacity.doc: Creates a new, empty Rust `Vec<Dom>` with a given, pre-allocated capacity

copy_from.doc: Creates + allocates a Rust `Vec<Dom>` by **copying** it from a bytes source

OptionChar.doc: Option<char> but the char is a u32, for C FFI stability reasons

AppConfig.doc: Configuration for optional features, such as whether to enable logging or panic hooks

log_level.doc: If enabled, logs error and info messages

enable_visual_panic_hook.doc: If the app crashes / panics, a window with a message box pops up

enable_logging_on_panic.doc: If set, a backtrace + error information gets logged to stdout (if the log_level is not `LogLevel::Off`)

enable_tab_navigation.doc: Whether keyboard navigation should be enabled

debug_state.doc: WebRender debug state for all windows (draws overdraw / frame time info on the screen)

default.doc: Creates a new AppConfig with default values

new.doc: Creates a new App instance from the given `AppConfig`

add_window.doc: Spawn a new window on the screen when the app is run.

run.doc: Runs the application. Due to platform restrictions (specifically `WinMain` on Windows), this function never returns.

callbacks.doc: Callback type definitions + struct definitions of `CallbackInfo`s

get_logical_size.doc: Returns the size of the bounds in logical units

get_physical_size.doc: Returns the size of the bounds in physical units

get_hidpi_factor.doc: Returns the hidpi factor of the bounds

FocusTarget.doc: Defines the focus target for the next frame

get_hit_node.doc: Returns the `DomNodeId` of the element that the callback was attached to.

get_cursor_relative_to_viewport.doc: Returns the `LayoutPoint` of the cursor in the viewport (relative to the origin of the `Dom`). Set to `None` if the cursor is not in the current window.

get_cursor_relative_to_node.doc: Returns the `LayoutPoint` of the cursor in the viewport (relative to the origin of the `Dom`). Set to `None` if the cursor is not hovering over the current node.

get_parent.doc: Returns the parent `DomNodeId` of the given `DomNodeId`. Returns `None` on an invalid NodeId.

get_previous_sibling.doc: Returns the previous siblings `DomNodeId` of the given `DomNodeId`. Returns `None` on an invalid NodeId.

get_next_sibling.doc: Returns the next siblings `DomNodeId` of the given `DomNodeId`. Returns `None` on an invalid NodeId.

get_first_child.doc: Returns the next siblings `DomNodeId` of the given `DomNodeId`. Returns `None` on an invalid NodeId.

get_last_child.doc: Returns the next siblings `DomNodeId` of the given `DomNodeId`. Returns `None` on an invalid NodeId.

get_dataset.doc: Returns the `Dataset` of the given `DomNodeId`. Returns `None` on an invalid NodeId.

get_window_state.doc: Returns a copy of the current windows `WindowState`.

get_keyboard_state.doc: Returns a copy of the internal `KeyboardState`. Same as `self.get_window_state().keyboard_state`

get_mouse_state.doc: Returns a copy of the internal `MouseState`. Same as `self.get_window_state().mouse_state`

get_current_window_handle.doc: Returns a copy of the current windows `RawWindowHandle`.

get_gl_context.doc: Returns a **reference-counted copy** of the current windows `GlContextPtr`. You can use this to render OpenGL textures.

set_window_state.doc: Sets the new `WindowState` for the next frame. The window is updated after all callbacks are run.

set_focus.doc: Sets the new `FocusTarget` for the next frame. Note that this will emit a `On::FocusLost` and `On::FocusReceived` event, if the focused node has changed.

set_css_property.doc: Sets a `CssProperty` on a given ndoe to its new value. If this property change affects the layout, this will automatically trigger a relayout and redraw of the screen.

stop_propagation.doc: Stops the propagation of the current callback event type to the parent. Events are bubbled from the inside out (children first, then parents), this event stops the propagation of the event to the parent.

create_window.doc: Spawns a new window with the given `WindowCreateOptions`.

start_thread.doc: Starts a new `Thread` to the runtime. See the documentation for `Thread` for more information.

start_timer.doc: Adds a new `Timer` to the runtime. See the documentation for `Timer` for more information.

UpdateScreen.doc: Specifies if the screen should be updated after the callback function has returned

DoNothing.doc: The screen does not need to redraw after the callback has been called

RegenerateStyledDomForCurrentWindow.doc: After the callback is called, the screen needs to redraw (layout() function being called again)

RegenerateStyledDomForAllWindows.doc: After the callback is called, the layout() function needs to be called again for ALL windows

get_gl_context.doc: Returns a copy of the internal `GlContextPtr`

get_bounds.doc: Returns a copy of the internal `HidpiAdjustedBounds`

RefAny.doc: RefAny is a reference-counted, type-erased pointer, which stores a reference to a struct. `RefAny` can be up- and downcasted (this usually done via generics and can't be expressed in the Rust API)

_internal_len.doc: Length of Vec holding type-erased struct

_internal_layout_align.doc: Alignment of the type-erased struct (usually 0 or 8)

type_id.doc: TypeId that can uniquely identify the type of the struct, usually generated by the compiler (i.e. in Rust it would be `std::any::TypeId`)

type_name.doc: Optional, name of the type, usually compiler-generated (in Rust, `std::any::type_name<T>()`)

sharing_info.doc: Pointer to the reference count of this `RefAny`. Calling `.clone()` will not clone the data, only bump the reference count by 1. When the `num_copies` reaches 0, the destructor of this `RefAny` is called

custom_destructor.doc: Function pointer to the destructor of `T`. Is called when the `num_copies` count of the `RefAny` reaches 0

get_bounds.doc: Returns a copy of the IFrame bounds

get_gl_context.doc: Returns a copy of the internal `GlContextPtr`

from_string.doc: Returns a CSS style parsed from a `String`

Stretch.doc: Default value. Lines stretch to take up the remaining space

Center.doc: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container

Start.doc: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container

End.doc: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container

SpaceBetween.doc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container

SpaceAround.doc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end

Stretch.doc: Items are stretched to fit the container

Center.doc: Items are positioned at the center of the container

FlexStart.doc: Items are positioned at the beginning of the container

FlexEnd.doc: Items are positioned at the end of the container

Start.doc: Default value. Items are positioned at the beginning of the container

End.doc: Items are positioned at the end of the container

Center.doc: Items are positioned at the center of the container

SpaceBetween.doc: Items are positioned with space between the lines

SpaceAround.doc: Items are positioned with space before, between, and after the lines

SpaceEvenly.doc: Items are distributed so that the spacing between any two adjacent alignment subjects, before the first alignment subject, and after the last alignment subject is the same

Scroll.doc: Always shows a scroll bar, overflows on scroll

Auto.doc: Does not show a scroll bar by default, only when text is overflowing

Hidden.doc: Never shows a scroll bar, simply clips text

Visible.doc: Doesn't show a scroll bar, simply overflows the text

ClosestSide.doc: The gradients ending shape meets the side of the box closest to its center (for circles) or meets both the vertical and horizontal sides closest to the center (for ellipses)

ClosestCorner.doc: The gradients ending shape is sized so that it exactly meets the closest corner of the box from its center

FarthestSide.doc: Similar to closest-side, except the ending shape is sized to meet the side of the box farthest from its center (or vertical and horizontal sides)

FarthestCorner.doc: The default value, the gradient's ending shape is sized so that it exactly meets the farthest corner of the box from its center

style.doc: DOM to CSS cascading and styling module

tag_id.doc: Optional hit-testing tag ID (NOTE: The tag ID has to be adjusted after the layout is done (to account for scroll tags))

new.doc: Styles a `Dom` with the given `Css`, returning the `StyledDom` - complexity `O(count(dom_nodes) * count(css_blocks))`: make sure that the `Dom` and the `Css` are as small as possible, use inline CSS if the performance isn't good enough

append.doc: Appends an already styled list of DOM nodes to the current `dom.root` - complexity `O(count(dom.dom_nodes))`

new.doc: Creates a new node with the given `NodeType`

label.doc: Creates a new `p` node with a given `String` as the text contents

text.doc: Creates a new `p` node from a (cached) text referenced by a `TextId`

image.doc: Creates a new `img` node from a (cached) text referenced by a `ImageId`

gl_texture.doc: Creates a new node which will render an OpenGL texture after the layout step is finished. See the documentation for [GlCallback]() for more info about OpenGL rendering callbacks.

iframe.doc: Creates a new node with a callback that will return a `Dom` after being layouted. See the documentation for [IFrameCallback]() for more info about iframe callbacks.

add_id.doc: Adds a CSS ID (`#something`) to the DOM node

with_id.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_id`](#method.add_id), but as a builder method

add_class.doc: Adds a CSS class (`.something`) to the DOM node

with_class.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_class`](#method.add_class), but as a builder method

add_callback.doc: Adds a [`Callback`](callbacks/type.Callback) that acts on the `data` the `event` happens

with_callback.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_callback`](#method.add_callback), but as a builder method
with_callback.fn_body: az_dom_add_callback(&mut dom, event, data, callback); dom

set_dataset.doc: Adds a dataset to the `Dom` root

with_dataset.doc: Same as [`Dom::set_dataset`](#method.set_dataset), but as a builder method

add_inline_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this DOM node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_css.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_inline_css`](#method.add_inline_css), but as a builder method

with_inline_css_props.doc: Same as [`Dom::set_inline_css_props`](#method.set_inline_css_props), but as a builder method

add_inline_hover_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this DOM node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_hover_css.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_inline_hover_css`](#method.add_inline_hover_css), but as a builder method

add_inline_active_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this DOM node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_active_css.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_inline_active_css`](#method.add_inline_active_css), but as a builder method

add_inline_focus_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this DOM node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_focus_css.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_inline_focus_css`](#method.add_inline_active_css), but as a builder method

set_is_draggable.doc: Sets the `is_draggable` attribute of this DOM node (default: false)

with_clip_mask.doc: Same as [`Dom::set_clip_mask`](#method.set_clip_mask), but as a builder method

set_clip_mask.doc: Sets the `clip_mask` attribute of this DOM node (default: None)

is_draggable.doc: Same as [`Dom::set_is_draggable`](#method.set_is_draggable), but as a builder method

set_tab_index.doc: Sets the `tabindex` attribute of this DOM node (makes an element focusable - default: None)

with_tab_index.doc: Same as [`Dom::set_tab_index`](#method.set_tab_index), but as a builder method

add_child.doc: Reparents another `Dom` to be the child node of this `Dom`

with_child.doc: Same as [`Dom::add_child`](#method.add_child), but as a builder method

get_html_string.doc: Returns the HTML String for this DOM

style.doc: Returns the HTML String for this DOM

NodeData.doc: Represents one single DOM node (node type, classes, ids and callbacks are stored here)

node_type.doc: Stores the type of the node, i.e. `div`, `img`, `p`, etc.

dataset.doc: `dataset` attribute of the node, useful to store any UI-related data on the node itself

ids_and_classes.doc: Stores the ids of the node, i.e. `[#main, #something]`

callbacks.doc: Stores the callbacks of the node, i.e. `On::MouseUp` -> `Callback(my_button_click_handler)`

inline_css_props.doc: Override certain dynamic styling properties for this DOM node

clip_mask.doc: Optional clip mask for this DOM node

is_draggable.doc: Whether this div can be dragged or not, similar to `draggable = "true"` in HTML

tab_index.doc: Whether this div can be focused, and if yes, in what default to `None` (not focusable). Note that without this, there can be no `On::FocusReceived` / `On::FocusLost` (equivalent to onfocus). For this reason, this is automatically set to `TabIndex::Auto` if a callback with `On::Focus*` is inserted

new.doc: Creates a new node without any classes or ids from a NodeType

label.doc: Creates a new `p` node with a given `String` as the text contents

text.doc: Creates a new `p` node from a (cached) text referenced by a `TextId`

image.doc: Creates a new `img` node from a (cached) text referenced by a `ImageId`

gl_texture.doc: Creates a new node which will render an OpenGL texture after the layout step is finished. See the documentation for [GlCallback]() for more info about OpenGL rendering callbacks.

iframe.doc: Creates a `NodeData` with a callback that will return a `Dom` after being layouted. See the documentation for [IFrameCallback]() for more info about iframe callbacks.

default.doc: Creates a default (div) node without any classes

add_id.doc: Adds a CSS ID (`#something`) to the `NodeData`

with_id.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_id`](#method.add_id), but as a builder method

add_class.doc: Adds a CSS class (`.something`) to the `NodeData`

with_class.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_class`](#method.add_class), but as a builder method

set_ids_and_classes.doc: Same as calling [`NodeData::add_id`](#method.add_id) for each CSS ID, but this function **replaces** all current CSS IDs

with_ids_and_classes.doc: Same as [`NodeData::set_ids_and_classes`](#method.set_ids_and_classes), but as a builder method

with_dataset.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_dataset`](#method.add_dataset), but as a builder method

add_callback.doc: Adds a [`Callback`](callbacks/type.Callback) that acts on the `data` the `event` happens

with_callback.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_callback`](#method.add_callback), but as a builder method
with_callback.fn_body: az_node_data_add_callback(&mut nodedata, event, data, callback); nodedata

add_inline_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this `NodeData` node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_css.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_inline_css`](#method.add_inline_css), but as a builder method

add_inline_hover_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this `NodeData` node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_hover_css.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_inline_hover_css`](#method.add_inline_hover_css), but as a builder method

add_inline_active_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this `NodeData` node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_active_css.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_inline_active_css`](#method.add_inline_active_css), but as a builder method

add_inline_focus_css.doc: Overrides the CSS property of this `NodeData` node with a value (for example `"width = 200px"`)

with_inline_focus_css.doc: Same as [`NodeData::add_inline_focus_css`](#method.add_inline_focus_css), but as a builder method

with_clip_mask.doc: Same as [`NodeData::set_clip_mask`](#method.set_clip_mask), but as a builder method

set_clip_mask.doc: Sets the `clip_mask` attribute of this `NodeData` (default: None)

set_is_draggable.doc: Sets the `is_draggable` attribute of this `NodeData` (default: false)

is_draggable.doc: Same as [`NodeData::set_is_draggable`](#method.set_is_draggable), but as a builder method

set_tab_index.doc: Sets the `tabindex` attribute of this `NodeData` (makes an element focusable - default: None)

with_tab_index.doc: Same as [`NodeData::set_tab_index`](#method.set_tab_index), but as a builder method

NodeType.doc: List of core DOM node types built-into by `azul`

Div.doc: Regular div with no particular type of data attached

Body.doc: Same as div, but only for the root node

Label.doc:
Equivalent to the HTML `

` tag, a small label that can be (optionally) be selected by the user

Text.doc:
Equivalent to the HTML `

` tag, but for a larger text whose layout can be cached

Image.doc: Equivalent to the HTML `` tag, references an image via its ID, the ID is created by the `add_image()` function(s)

GlTexture.doc: OpenGL texture, behaves same as a `<canvas>` / `img` node. Can be selected in CSS with the `"gltexture"` selector.

IFrame.doc: Callback that renders a DOM when invoked with a width / height after the layout of the parent DOM is done. Can be selected in CSS with the `"iframe"` selector.

On.doc: When to call a callback action - `On::MouseOver`, `On::MouseOut`, etc.

MouseOver.doc: Mouse cursor is hovering over the element

MouseDown.doc: Mouse cursor has is over element and is pressed (not good for "click" events - use `MouseUp` instead)

LeftMouseDown.doc: (Specialization of `MouseDown`). Fires only if the left mouse button has been pressed while cursor was over the element

MiddleMouseDown.doc: (Specialization of `MouseDown`). Fires only if the middle mouse button has been pressed while cursor was over the element

RightMouseDown.doc: (Specialization of `MouseDown`). Fires only if the right mouse button has been pressed while cursor was over the element

MouseUp.doc: Mouse button has been released while cursor was over the element

LeftMouseUp.doc: (Specialization of `MouseUp`). Fires only if the left mouse button has been released while cursor was over the element

MiddleMouseUp.doc: (Specialization of `MouseUp`). Fires only if the middle mouse button has been released while cursor was over the element

RightMouseUp.doc: (Specialization of `MouseUp`). Fires only if the right mouse button has been released while cursor was over the element

MouseEnter.doc: Mouse cursor has entered the element

MouseLeave.doc: Mouse cursor has left the element

TextInput.doc: The window received a unicode character (also respects the system locale)

VirtualKeyDown.doc: Check `keyboard_state.current_char` to get the current pressed character

VirtualKeyUp.doc: A **virtual keycode** was pressed. Note: This is only the virtual keycode, not the actual char. If you want to get the character, use `TextInput` instead. **NOTE**: A virtual key does not have to map to a printable character. You can get all currently pressed virtual keycodes in the `keyboard_state.current_virtual_keycodes` and / or just the last keycode in the `keyboard_state.latest_virtual_keycode`.

Auto.doc: Automatic tab index, similar to simply setting `focusable = "true"` or `tabindex = 0`, (both have the effect of making the element focusable)

OverrideInParent.doc: Set the tab index in relation to its parent element (`tabindex = n`)

NoKeyboardFocus.doc: Elements can be focused in callbacks, but are not accessible via keyboard / tab navigation (`tabindex = -1` )

GetActiveAttribReturn.doc: C-ABI stable reexport of `(i32, u32, AzString)`

GetActiveUniformReturn.doc: C-ABI stable reexport of `(i32, u32, AzString)`

read_pixels_into_buffer.fn_body: glcontextptr.read_pixels_into_buffer(x, y, width, height, format, pixel_type, dst_buffer)

read_pixels.fn_body: glcontextptr.read_pixels(x, y, width, height, format, pixel_type)

read_pixels_into_pbo.fn_body: glcontextptr.read_pixels_into_pbo(x, y, width, height, format, pixel_type)

tex_image_2d.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_image_2d(target, level, internal_format, width, height, border, format, ty, opt_data)

compressed_tex_image_2d.fn_body: glcontextptr.compressed_tex_image_2d(target, level, internal_format, width, height, border, data)

compressed_tex_sub_image_2d.fn_body: glcontextptr.compressed_tex_sub_image_2d(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, width, height, format, data)

tex_image_3d.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_image_3d(target, level, internal_format, width, height, depth, border, format, ty, opt_data)

copy_tex_image_2d.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_tex_image_2d(target, level, internal_format, x, y, width, height, border)

copy_tex_sub_image_2d.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_tex_sub_image_2d(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, x, y, width, height)

copy_tex_sub_image_3d.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_tex_sub_image_3d(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, zoffset, x, y, width, height)

tex_sub_image_2d.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_sub_image_2d(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, width, height, format, ty, data)

tex_sub_image_2d_pbo.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_sub_image_2d_pbo(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, width, height, format, ty, offset)

tex_sub_image_3d.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_sub_image_3d(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, zoffset, width, height, depth, format, ty, data)

tex_sub_image_3d_pbo.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_sub_image_3d_pbo(target, level, xoffset, yoffset, zoffset, width, height, depth, format, ty, offset)

tex_storage_3d.fn_body: glcontextptr.tex_storage_3d(target, levels, internal_format, width, height, depth)

copy_image_sub_data.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_image_sub_data(src_name, src_target, src_level, src_x, src_y, src_z, dst_name, dst_target, dst_level, dst_x, dst_y, dst_z, src_width, src_height, src_depth)

blit_framebuffer.fn_body: glcontextptr.blit_framebuffer(src_x0, src_y0, src_x1, src_y1, dst_x0, dst_y0, dst_x1, dst_y1, mask, filter)

vertex_attrib_pointer.fn_body: glcontextptr.vertex_attrib_pointer(index, size, type_, normalized, stride, offset)

copy_texture_chromium.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_texture_chromium(source_id, source_level, dest_target, dest_id, dest_level, internal_format, dest_type, unpack_flip_y, unpack_premultiply_alpha, unpack_unmultiply_alpha)

copy_sub_texture_chromium.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_sub_texture_chromium(source_id, source_level, dest_target, dest_id, dest_level, x_offset, y_offset, x, y, width, height, unpack_flip_y, unpack_premultiply_alpha, unpack_unmultiply_alpha)

copy_texture_3d_angle.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_texture_3d_angle(source_id, source_level, dest_target, dest_id, dest_level, internal_format, dest_type, unpack_flip_y, unpack_premultiply_alpha, unpack_unmultiply_alpha)

copy_sub_texture_3d_angle.fn_body: glcontextptr.copy_sub_texture_3d_angle(source_id, source_level, dest_target, dest_id, dest_level, x_offset, y_offset, z_offset, x, y, z, width, height, depth, unpack_flip_y, unpack_premultiply_alpha, unpack_unmultiply_alpha)

format.doc: Format of this texture (rgba, brga, etc.)

flags.doc: Hints and flags for optimization purposes

gl_context.doc: A reference-counted pointer to the OpenGL context (so that the texture can be deleted in the destructor)

is_opaque.doc: Whether this texture contains an alpha component

is_video_texture.doc: Optimization: use the compositor instead of OpenGL for energy efficiency

default.doc: Default texture flags (not opaque, not a video texture)

resources.doc: Struct definition for image / font / text IDs

Embedded.doc: Bytes of the image, encoded in PNG / JPG / etc. format

File.doc: References an (encoded!) image as a file from the file system that is loaded when necessary

Raw.doc: References a decoded (!) `RawImage` as the image source

Embedded.doc: Bytes are the bytes of the font file

File.doc: References a font from a file path, which is loaded when necessary

System.doc: References a font from from a system font identifier, such as `"Arial"` or `"Helvetica"`

new.doc: Creates a new `RawImage` by loading the decoded bytes
new.fn_body: RawImage { pixels: decoded_pixels, width, height, data_format: data_format }

R8.doc: Bytes are in the R-unsinged-8bit format

R16.doc: Bytes are in the R-unsinged-16bit format

RG16.doc: Bytes are in the RG-unsinged-16bit format

BGRA8.doc: Bytes are in the BRGA-unsigned-8bit format

RGBAF32.doc: Bytes are in the RGBA-floating-point-32bit format

RG8.doc: Bytes are in the RG-unsigned-8bit format

RGBAI32.doc: Bytes are in the RGBA-signed-32bit format

RGBA8.doc: Bytes are in the RGBA-unsigned-8bit format

relative_image_path.doc: SVG image path. Used to resolve relative image paths.

dpi.doc: Target DPI. Impact units conversion. Default: 96.0

default_font_family.doc: Default font family. Will be used when no font-family attribute is set in the SVG. Default: Times New Roman

font_size.doc: A default font size. Will be used when no font-size attribute is set in the SVG. Default: 12

languages.doc: A list of languages. Will be used to resolve a systemLanguage conditional attribute. Format: en, en-US. Default: [en]

shape_rendering.doc: Specifies the default shape rendering method. Will be used when an SVG element's shape-rendering property is set to auto. Default: GeometricPrecision

text_rendering.doc: Specifies the default text rendering method. Will be used when an SVG element's text-rendering property is set to auto. Default: OptimizeLegibility

image_rendering.doc: Specifies the default image rendering method. Will be used when an SVG element's image-rendering property is set to auto. Default: OptimizeQuality

keep_named_groups.doc: Keep named groups. If set to true, all non-empty groups with id attribute will not be removed. Default: false

fontdb.doc: When empty, text elements will be skipped. Default: `System`

line_join.doc: How to tesselate edges in a path, default value = `Miter`

miter_limit.doc: Limit for caps on path edges if line_join is set to `Miter`, (multiplied * 1000 as usize). Must be greater than or equal to 1px (`1000`). Default value = 1px (`1000`)

tolerance.doc: Maximum allowed distance between path points when tesselating curves. Default value = 0.1px (`100`)

start_cap.doc: What cap to use at the start of each sub-path, default value = `Butt`

end_cap.doc: What cap to use at the end of each sub-path, default value = `Butt`

line_join.doc: How to tesselate edges in a path, default value = `Miter`

dash_pattern.doc: Optional dash pattern for the stroke, default value = `None`

line_width.doc: Width of the line in px, (multiplied * 1000 as usize). Default value = 1px (`1000`)

miter_limit.doc: Limit for caps on path edges if line_join is set to `Miter`, (multiplied * 1000 as usize). Must be greater than or equal to 1px (`1000`). Default value = 1px (`1000`)

tolerance.doc: Maximum allowed distance between path points when tesselating curves. Default value = 0.1px (`100`)

apply_line_width.doc: When set to false, the generated vertices will all be positioned in the center. The width can be applied later on (eg in a vertex shader) by adding the vertex normal multiplied by the line with to each vertex position. Default value = `false`

task.doc: Asyncronous timers / task / thread handlers for easy async loading

data.doc: Stores some timer-specific data (usually animation data)

created.doc: Stores when the timer was created (usually acquired by `Instant::now()`)

last_run.doc: When the timer was last called (`None` only when the timer hasn't been called yet)

run_count.doc: How often the timer was run already

delay.doc: If the timer shouldn't start instantly, but rather be delayed by a certain duration

interval.doc: How frequently the timer should run, i.e. set this to `Some(Duration::from_millis(16))` to run the timer every 16ms. If this value is set to `None`, (the default), the timer will execute the timer as-fast-as-possible (i.e. at a faster framerate than the framework itself) - which might be  performance intensive.

timeout.doc: When to stop the timer (for example, you can stop the execution after 5s using `Some(Duration::from_secs(5))`).

callback.doc: Callback to be called for this timer

TerminateTimer.doc: Should a timer terminate or not - used to remove active timers

Terminate.doc: Remove the timer from the list of active timers

Continue.doc: Do nothing and let the timers continue to run

connection.doc: A pointer to an X server `xcb_connection_t`

hinstance.doc: The HINSTANCE associated with this type's HWND

id.doc: An ID value inserted into the data attributes of the canvas element as 'raw-handle'. Invalid = 0.

Desktop.doc: A desktop feature. This can include a single window containing desktop icons with the same dimensions as the screen, allowing the desktop environment to have full control of the desktop, without the need for proxying root window clicks

Dock.doc: A dock or panel feature. Typically a Window Manager would keep such windows on top of all other windows

Toolbar.doc: Toolbar windows. "Torn off" from the main application

Menu.doc: Pinnable menu windows. "Torn off" from the main application

Utility.doc: A small persistent utility window, such as a palette or toolbox

Splash.doc: The window is a splash screen displayed as an application is starting up

DropdownMenu.doc: A dropdown menu that usually appears when the user clicks on an item in a menu bar. This property is typically used on override-redirect windows.

PopupMenu.doc: A popup menu that usually appears when the user right clicks on an object. This property is typically used on override-redirect windows.

Tooltip.doc: A tooltip window. Usually used to show additional information when hovering over an object with the cursor. This property is typically used on override-redirect windows.

Notification.doc: The window is a notification. This property is typically used on override-redirect windows.

Combo.doc: This should be used on the windows that are popped up by combo boxes. This property is typically used on override-redirect windows.

Dnd.doc: This indicates the the window is being dragged. This property is typically used on override-redirect windows.

Normal.doc: This is a normal, top-level window

is_about_to_close.doc: Is the window about to close on the next frame? Setting this to true will close the window.

has_decorations.doc: Does the window have decorations (close, minimize, maximize, title bar)?

is_always_on_top.doc: Is the window always on top?

has_focus.doc: Whether the window is currently focused (changing this field will request user attention)

has_blur_behind_window.doc: Whether the window has a background blur

shift_down.doc: Tracks, if the `Shift` key is currently pressed - (READONLY)

ctrl_down.doc: Tracks, if the `Ctrl` key is currently pressed - (READONLY)

alt_down.doc: Tracks, if the `Alt` key is currently pressed - (READONLY)

super_down.doc: Tracks, if the `Super / Windows / Command` key is currently pressed - (READONLY)

current_virtual_keycode.doc: Currently pressed `VirtualKeyCode` - (READONLY). **DO NOT USE THIS FOR TEXT INPUT, USE `current_char` and `On::TextInput` instead.**

pressed_virtual_keycodes.doc: List of currently held-down `VirtualKeyCodes` - useful to implement combinated shortcuts (ex. `Ctrl + Shift + Right`)

pressed_scancodes.doc: List of currently held-down `ScanCode`s (typedef for `u32`). Same as `current_virtual_keycodes`, but the scancode identifies the physical key pressed, independent of the keyboard layout. The scancode does not change if the user adjusts the host's keyboard map. Use when the physical location of the key is more important than the key's host GUI semantics, such as for movement controls in a first-person game (German keyboard: Z key, UK keyboard: Y key, etc.)

mouse_cursor_type.doc: Current mouse cursor type, set to `None` if the cursor is hidden. (READWRITE)

cursor_position.doc: Current mouse cursor type, set to `None` if the cursor is hidden. (READWRITE)

is_cursor_locked.doc: Is the mouse cursor locked to the current window (important for applications like games)? (READWRITE)

left_down.doc: Is the left mouse button down? (READONLY)

right_down.doc: Is the right mouse button down? (READONLY)

middle_down.doc: Is the middle mouse button down? (READONLY)

scroll_x.doc: Scroll amount in pixels in the horizontal direction. Gets reset to 0 after every frame (READONLY)

scroll_y.doc: Scroll amount in pixels in the vertical direction. Gets reset to 0 after every frame (READONLY)

allow_drag_drop.doc: STARTUP ONLY: Whether the window should allow drag + drop operations (default: true)

window_icon.doc: STARTUP ONLY: Window icon (decoded bytes), usually 32x32x4 bytes large (`ICON_SMALL`), appears at the top right corner of the window

taskbar_icon.doc: READWRITE: Taskbar icon (decoded bytes), usually 256x256x4 bytes large (`ICON_BIG`). Can be changed in callbacks / at runtime.

parent_window.doc: READWRITE: Taskbar icon (decoded bytes), usually 256x256x4 bytes large (`ICON_BIG`). Can be changed in callbacks / at runtime.

primary_color_active.doc: Primary color when the window is focused

primary_color_inactive.doc: Primary color when the window is unfocused

secondary_color_active.doc: Secondary color when the window is focused

secondary_color_inactive.doc: Secondary color when the window is unfocused

x11_visual.doc: Which X11 visual to use for the window (unimplemented). Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks

x11_screen.doc: Which screen to use when showing the window (unimplemented). Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks

x11_wm_classes.doc: Build window with `WM_CLASS` hint; defaults to the name of the binary. Only relevant on X11. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

x11_override_redirect.doc: Build window with override-redirect flag; defaults to false. Only relevant on X11. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

x11_window_types.doc: Build window with `_NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE` hint; defaults to `Normal`. Only relevant on X11. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

x11_gtk_theme_variant.doc: Build window with `_GTK_THEME_VARIANT` hint set to the specified value. Currently only relevant on X11. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

x11_resize_increments.doc: Build window with resize increment hint. Only implemented on X11. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

x11_base_size.doc: Build window with base size hint. Only implemented on X11. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

wayland_app_id.doc: Build window with a given application ID. It should match the `.desktop` file distributed with the program. Only relevant on Wayland. Can only be set at window creation, can't be changed in callbacks.

wayland_theme.doc: Window decoration of the window minimize / maximize / close buttons

request_user_attention.doc: Whether the window icon should blink to request the users attention.

window_icon.doc: Sets the window icon of the program

SlowFullScreen.doc:
- macOS: If the window is in windowed mode, transitions it slowly to fullscreen mode}
- other: Does the same as `FastFullScreen`.

FastFullScreen.doc: Window should immediately go into fullscreen mode (on macOS this is not the default behaviour).

SlowWindowed.doc:
- macOS: If the window is in fullscreen mode, transitions slowly back to windowed state.
- other: Does the same as `FastWindowed`.

FastWindowed.doc: If the window is in fullscreen mode, will immediately go back to windowed mode (on macOS this is not the default behaviour).

theme.doc: Current theme of the window (dark or light mode)

size.doc: Size of the window + max width / max height: 800 x 600 by default

position.doc: The x and y position, or None to let the WM decide where to put the window (default)

flags.doc: Flags such as whether the window is minimized / maximized, fullscreen, etc.

debug_state.doc: Mostly used for debugging, shows WebRender-builtin graphs on the screen. Used for performance monitoring and displaying frame times (rendering-only).

keyboard_state.doc: Current keyboard state - NOTE: mutating this field (currently) does nothing (doesn't get synchronized with OS-level window)!

touch_state.doc: Current touch state, stores all states of currently connected touch input devices, pencils, tablets, etc. - NOTE: readonly field - mutating this field will not get synchronized with the OS

ime_position.doc: Sets location of IME candidate box in client area coordinates (relative to the top left of the window)

platform_specific_options.doc: Window options that can only be set on a certain platform (`WindowsWindowOptions` / `LinuxWindowOptions` / `MacWindowOptions`).

renderer_options.doc: Whether this window has SRGB / vsync / hardware acceleration

background_color.doc: Color of the window background (can be transparent if necessary)

close_callback.doc: Callback to run before the window closes, if `DoNothing` is returned, window won't close

create_callback.doc: Callback to run once when the window is created
